page.title: 18SUPERNATURAL & FOLKLORE.
page.content: Many stories are told about the area, most famous being about Jan Tregeagle ,said to have been chased through St. Stephens by headless hounds. Ghost stories are rare,but in Coombe we heard of an old grey lady spirit seen by the roadside.There are rumours of a secret tunnel linking a local pub to St.Stephens Church.True stories still told are about two seperate murders that occurred over forty years ago, and at the Kings Arms Inn there is a photograph,one hundred years old,of two men who badly bit each other in a fight.Superstitions are common among the old people,although not always treated seriously.Magpies are always respected:it is usual to greet a lone Magpie with" Mornin Mr. Magpie."Other superstitions are;not going through the same door twice,and hanging washingout in a certain day for luck.
